info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy Rain and Snow showers will impact portions the St. Lawrence Valley and western Adirondacks through 745 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, a line of heavy rain showers were reported along a line approximately 20 miles for the St. Lawrence River moving east at 50 mph. Initially heavy rain showers will change to rain and snow mixed before changing to heavy snow showers. Mixed snow and rain showers in the Adirondacks will quickly change to snow. HAZARD...Winds 30 mph or greater, and visibility less than a mile in snow showers. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility may pose a hazard to motorists, esepcially as the rain changes to snow. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Massena, Gouverneur, Canton, Ogdensburg, Norfolk, Oswegatchie, Lisbon, Louisville, Moira, De Kalb, Bangor, Fowler, Parishville, Fort Covington, Colton, Bombay, Massena International Airport - Richards Field, Helena and Hammond.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
